DESCRIPTION.P: A call to this function will load into Scilab a set of macros which describes dynamical systems. Their parameters can be initiated by calling the routine tdinit().

ITEMIZE.label: COMPET
ITEMIZE.P: a competition model. x(1),x(2) stands for two populations which grows on a same resource. 1/u is the level of that resource ( 1 is the default value).
"The macro [xe]=equilcom(ue)" computes an equilibrium point of the competition model and a fixed level of the resource ue ( default value is 1)

"The macro [f,g,h,linsy]=lincomp([ue])" gives the linearisation of the competition model ( with output y=x) around the equilibrium point xe=equilcom(ue). This macro returns [f,g,h] the three matrices of the linearised system. and linsy which is a Scilab macro [ydot]=linsy(t,x) which computes the dynamics of the linearised system

ITEMIZE.label: CYCLlIM
ITEMIZE.P: a model with a limit cycle

ITEMIZE.label: BLINPER
ITEMIZE.P: a linear system with quadratic perturbations.

ITEMIZE.label: PROIE
ITEMIZE.P: a Predator prey model with external insecticide.
ITEMIZE.ITEM: The prey ( that we want to kill )
the predator ( that we want to preserve )
mortality rate due to insecticide which destroys both prey and predator ( default value u=0)
ITEMIZE.P: The macro [xe]=equilpp([ue]) computes the equilibrium point of the p_p system for the value ue of the command. The default value for ue is 0.
